title: Pork meatloaf with soured cream (Faschierter Rahmbraten)
description: This very traditional Austrian dish is probably the moistest meatloaf we’ve ever tasted. It’s deeply savoury and really easy to make. We cooked it at a pumpkin farm in Austria, where we found out that pumpkin oil is one of the country’s main crops. How about that?
ingredients: 500g/1lb 2oz pork mince, or a mixture of beef and pork mince
1 tbsp dried marjoram or 2 tbsp fresh marjoram leaves, chopped
a few sprigs of fresh marjoram, to garnish (optional)
